definition: anti-Qing/refers to the revolutionary movements in late 19th and early 20th century leading up to 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4]
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Forget that against the qing dynasty the mission of tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 忘记瞭反清复明的使命了吗？

sentences.english: Farmer social class counter-clear revolution thought stimulating.
sentences.chinese: 农民阶级反清思想的刺激。

definition: opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
uprising/insurrection/revolt
anti-Qing secret societies
Tiandihui (Chinese fraternal organization)
the Qing court (as government of China)
Taiping Heavenly Kingdom (1851-1864)
late-Qing underground resistance movement against the Qing dynasty
White Lotus society
Nian Army, leading a peasant rebellion against the Qing dynasty in Shandong, Henan, Jiangsu and Anhui 1851-1868, at the same time as the Taiping Rebellion further south
Three feudatories rebellion against Qing 1673-1681 during the reign of Kangxi
Wuchang Uprising of October 10th, 1911, which led to Sun Yat-sen's Xinhai Revolution and the fall of the Qing dynasty
Revive China Society, founded by Dr Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山 in 1894 in Honolulu
anti-Qing revolutionary party set up in 1904 under Cai Yuanpei 蔡元培/same as 復古會|复古会
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
